page.title: 16ECOLOGY WELBURY &DEIGHTON
page.content: This gently undulating area lies 5 miles west of the Cleveland Hills and is drained by the River Wiske. There are several small ponds some occupying disused clay pits. Deighton & Welbury are on higher ground,the latter being named because of its many springs & wells. There is little natural vegetation;fields have hawthorn hedges broken by ash or oak.Green Lane is popular in Welbury for collecting brambles,sloes,damsons & hazelnuts, while children prefer Deighton for"conkers"collected from horse- chestnut trees bordering the road.Deer,fox & heron are occasionally seen.Pheasants are common game birds.It is a cool windy area affected by the North Sea.However it is a green ,pleasant & peaceful environment,out of the pollution of Teesside. .
